comments.body:
You could have at least tried to make it funny by referencing the younglings from Star Wars or something.

Why should we want this?
Just why?
It is a very bad idea because it would not be useful also it is contradictory because minecraft says not to hit the villagers because they are peaceful because we would want that
You... you.... MONSTER!
gostei
that is clever

Coal is too 3D and detalied, iron is blurry, low-cobtrast and too cracked, redstone looks like stone with some big unbalanced holes filled with red idk, gold ore is nether gold ore and grimstone is too dark.
Also they should keep the old iron ore, but change the diamond ore to be like emerald but more rounded

I think texture of redstone should be tiny but much red spots since redstone itself is a kind of dust, and iron in ore should be like nudgets.
Or perhaps Mojang can add an option in the accessibility settings to control the loading of new textures for color blindness.
(The latest texture of iron ore is sooooooo ugly!!!)

Yes  I agree the current textures are bad. I can deal with everything except for iron, the iron texture is way to different than what it used to be. I think it should have smaller pieces and maybe be more circley like the previous iron texture that was brought in 21w07a. Also I like the addition of the cobbled version of deepslate (grimstone) but I think the sides of the natural version should also be smooth.
You can choose in minecraft, if you want to kill every villager, you can do that. It isn't a good idea to ad good and evil to minecraft, because you wont be able to be neutral.
And it would be nice if the axolotl caught with a bucket kept the name tag it possesses
Renaming a Bucket of Anything should spawn the mob with that name. Picking up a named mob should turn the bucket into the name of the mob

Now it is a feature.

It was a bug.
You could have Powder Snow buckets have a bar indicating how many blocks it has, although that may be better for powder snow layers
If Powder Snow was like a liquid then it would make sense for it to only hold 1 block

Having Powder Snow be a liquid would also add some interesting mechanics. For example, snow blocks could turn into powder snow blocks, similar to how ice turns into water. The powder snow would then flow down the mountains, creating a sort of avalanche. They could even turn back into solid blocks once they stop moving
I saw another post which I liked, which was that the block could be obtained by mining it with silk touch
Yes this would be great because even late game obsidian is tedious to get large amounts of!
It would be enough for me if cauldrons interacted (empty/fill) with dispensed buckets.

credit to cammie's minecart tweaks for the chain idea, but I really want it in minecraft. The freight rail system is something I personally struggle with since i dont really have any plans on when i want to defeat the dragon in my survival world but i want a lot of freight to be able to be transported at once
it would also be useful in transporting mobs using rails, and in building multi-seat rollercoasters
yes build on this please. be nice to tow along rail carts behind. can be helpful with minecart hoppers as well to tow behind the player.

I totally agree! Once again, Microsoft is afraid to bloat the game, and keeps Mojang from adding amazing features! That is probably why every april fools snapshot is fun, and updates are slow.. The copper-bulb was amazing just as it was, and would introduce new aspects into redstone instead of introducing concepts that we already have. Instead of helping us out giving us something new, Mojang gives us useless concepts that we already have.
I think it would not make sense to have them made with redstone, so new skulk blocks will surely be needed...

I think the frogs should spawn with a goat friendliness score on a bell curve. 80-120 won't attack or be attacked by goats. 121-135 they'll attack the goat. 136+, the frog will tend to eat goats.

Below 80 goats will attack the frog.
Good idea. Long life to Minecraft logic!
If frogs spat them back out like kirby, this could be an extremely hilarious way to create a goat horn farm if goats dropped their horn upon being ate.
The frog should spit out all its goats when killed, or else it would drop goat horns if there are any.
Maybe it could give you a freezing effect for a few seconds too, otherwise this is just a charged creeper reskin.
Great idea to be honest.
real

I would like to note, the new block update ORDER with redstone is a great change and should stay. It may break some old contraptions, but it doesn't remove functionality and it makes redstone update orders much more intuitive.
Totaly agree! The old interface looked a lot more "minecrafty" and showed all the items. I also do agree with the unstackable item thing.

I really doubt it will be added, but I am a strong advocate for some version of the bundle (if not the base version, than an late game upgraded version like a "compression sack") be added to the game. The main purpose of the bundle is to remove junk from exploring, but a lot of the junk we get are things like bows and swords dropped by skeletons and nether mobs. Being able to put up to 8 unstackable items in a bundle will allow us to make tool kits that take up only one stot instead of 8 and would free up so much storage. It would also address issues with potions, allowing us to store 8 potions in a single slot so we can do tasks like working in the nether or underwater for longer periods of time without taking up shulker boxes worth of storage or constantly refueling.

The one key exception that must be made are shulker boxes; just like they are now, they must not be placeable in a bundle.

Also, something that stacks to 16 like Ender Pearls should also benefit from this system. Right now you can put 16 Ender Pearls or Signs in a Bundle (each one uses 4 units), but it should be more like 32 per bundle (2 units per). Basically here is the equation:

Normal Stack in Inventory => Stack in Bundle
1 per stack => 8  per bundle (8 units per)
16 stack => 32 per bundle (2 units per)
64 per stack => 64 per bundle (1 unit per)
I really love this idea! This way we can have best of both worlds! ðŸ¤©
100% this. They could also make the silenced pistons not trigger skulk sensors when they're triggered, giving redstoners more options when using skulk

I still trying to figure out the best way to make it work for complex recipes, the only thing it came from my mind is that would be nice to have a filter slot system like the crafting table recipes

Alternative to that, would be the crafter emit more redstone signals like:

0 to 9 - each slot filled

10 to 16 - each amount of craftables items already filled

we can use the 10+ signal as a check if i can craft more than one item to activate it once, leaving always one recipe filled as a item filter, allowing to just fill hoppers with the items needed and they'll sorted by itself inside the crafter.

While testing with my wife (which is more a "decoration person" more or less of a "redstone person"), she liked the block idea to make more decorative items and faster, but the execution put her away from it, we agreed it will make more sense to lose one crafting by leaving on it as a filter than dealing with how the difficult (and space consuming) scales for each auto crafting system would need.

Also this would make the whole experience more unified, simple recipes (like iron only ones) already just need a hopper, a Redstone Comparator to check if it is filled to make it work, having almost the same experience to complex recipes would be excellent to introduce redstone to casual and new players, and convinient for redstone experienced ones and hardcore players.

I agree with the other commenter that a signal strength of 10 for all useable slots having multiple items would be game changing for the average player. 11-16 might not be useful imo, but the 10th signal allows users to guarantee that their recipes will not break without advanced redstone use. It will only take one circuit for complex recipes to work easily. A non-technical player will never use the crafter for anything complicated if this feature does not come in. The only downside I see is that this might possibly be too powerful - but it really only provides easy access to the feature for everyone. I will look for another post where it specifically suggests this in the main post and link it here, and if I do not find one, I will post one to the best of my ability.

Edit: here is a permalink on the official main crafter thread: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/20459106029709/comments/20497631493901

I feel like this is the exact oposite of what the crafter should do. This would make it too simple and overpowered. You have to keep in mind that every new mechanic needs balancing. Where'Ä‘ the fun in redstone when you have such a straight forward answer to everything. "The more constraints one imposes, the more one frees one's self. And the arbitrariness of the constraint serves only to obtain precision of execution." - Igor Stravinsky
NO
NO. IT IS FINE AS IS

Would like to express my frustration with this as well. if we can't choose the recipe we want, allow us to set it and only activate if there are enough items for it beyond the base amount given.

Example: Add 9 iron ingots, even if given a redstone signal it would NOT activate until a total of 2 iron ingots for all 9 slots are available

The base layer of items would act as a 'template'

I do prefer the OPs option better however as in my example such a thing like an auto crafter using minecarts wouldn't be possible.

But without either option it becomes very frustrating to get so many iron bars and heavy weight pressure plates when the signal doesn't line up with the available recipe.

setting say 32 iron ingots in each slot within the crafter is very wasteful, and still can break easily by either getting too many items at once, or not enough. Because of this the crafter has limited options to such recipes like nether bricks, bricks, copper blocks, dried kelp blocks, ie things that only have a single material and no other conflicting valid recipes.
they seriously need to consider this, this is a good point
Yes, I was very upset when I realized they had for some reason changed this.
Maybe add back the enchantment glint to potions, but make the glint color match the potion color. This would also mapmakers by for example adding a "enchantment_glint_color" nbt to items.

I feel like the enchantment glint changes we've been getting are way too much. I guess two different textures is okay for resource pack reasons, but it also feels weird and not needed, like a strange inconsistency or something. I know this is being done for the armor trims, but I feel like the current item glint fits perfectly fine on armor, and the trims would still be visible. 1.15 also made the glint too strong; a texture mimicking pre-1.15's glint would look nicer too, although I guess it didn't glow in darkness then. The current armor glint is way too subtle, imo it's not nice having moments where the glint can't be seen.

The potion glint removal also feels like it hurts the magic. The current item glint seems subtler than 1.7's, so removing it seems very strange. Removing it also makes water bottles, no effect potions, and water breathing potions very similar, since at least water breathing had the glint, while the no effect potions didn't (night vision may have this issue too). I guess the current glint could make potions appear very purple for a moment in the animation, but still it doesn't seem like it'd obscure the colors too much; at least, I didn't notice troubles with them, but I see others have...maybe if they had a different animation that kept the magic touch?

Other than the enchantment glint stuff (besides the nice and clean item glint, it's cool), I think what's been done has been awesome.

I like being able to see the textures of potions better! But now that they're not covered by the enchantment glint, I think it's time that the potions get a resprite. Making the liquid look a little better and maybe adding some colored highlights could bring back the magical look, while keeping the visibility.
there should be a option to put back the old create menu like what you did with the programmer texture pack
The brush recipe is an improvement, but it makes more sense to have 3 feathers vs 1 for the whole brush.
Maybe potions could have unique textures, easier to identify at a glance or helpful for the colourblind.
With the "high contast" UI option, there should also be a "dark mode" UI option.

This pre-release has chat reporting, therefore, it is a bad patch.

Hi! i have suggestion for a new /execute sub command. In this pre-release we got the "/execute positioned over" sub command. I think it's great! But this got me thinking about another execute suv command I wanted in the game for a really long time, "/execute if weather". This could be really cool combined with "/execute positioned over". You could check if you're in the rain and not under a block. Or you could check if you're in a snowy biome if it's snowing. Or check if you're in a thunderstorm. I would love to have this new sub command in the game! I already love the new commands and sub commands you put in the game. Really really cool!

personally the new creative menu and new world option screen is...not it
theres not a lot that goes into making a new world so why is it split up into THREE sections?

the creative menu...i mean its...fine, but id much rather have it the way its been for YEARS

or at the very least, an option to change it back

its great yall are trying some new stuff but sometimes if it aint broke, dont fix it

The tabs of the world creation screen are coming along nicely, though I feel it'd help differentiate them from the rest of the menu if they started with grass side textures. (Maybe with podzol/other variants to further help distinguish each tab, or as a small chance easteregg) I feel it'd be a very cute/charming addition to the menu as well
Quand-Esque Minecraft Java Sors Sur Console

Make it so block and item models can have tints not just tint indexâ€™s since people may want to make a block change colour for mods or resource packs since tints are hardcoded even if the model supports tints
I think, now that it's easier to see potions that potions should have different liquid textures to help with accessibility!
you cant dismount any entity that is not supposed to be ridden (anything other than boats, pigs, horses etc.) using the ride command.

I don't like how items in the inventory don't match the enchantments speed/strength as the ones on armor do. Holding the enchanted items in the player hand causes it so the items glint looks much stronger on held items than armor. I prefer to just have the minimal enchantment glint on the inventory items I really liked it and I want it back.
Penso che la pozione di night vision debba tornare blu oppure blu violaceo

Can you shorten the extension of function files in minecraft? . mcfunction is long to write and it can be boring when we can't automate the writing of our code. It can also be annoying to have very long filenames for simple stuff like x_pattern.mcfunction. I propose to add an extension like .mf or .mcf (in agreement with .mcmeta), which has exactly the same function as .mcfunction. It would also be better to keep .mcfunction to allow backward compatibility of datapacks.
chat reporting sucks but in all it seems it be ok where your on a survival world by your self not sure if its a bug but the villagers from the village by my base are all gone its kind of annoying

When it talks about display entities and it says "When a new interpolation is started, it now starts from the current state instead of the final state" what does that mean? My animations are broken but they were fine on the previous patch, how do I fix this? What is the "current" state and how do I make an animation loop smoothly like the previous snapshot?
With the new multi noise presets can you add a codec for multinoise settings like dimensions do and fix normal world type not being overridden
And I think that, It will be nicer, if those white cherry blossom trees cannot be farmable, for making the biome more unique

I like the shape of the trees and over all look. The only issue I have is the cherry leaves look too patterned and dense. It makes the trees look more blocky as well as the pattern looking a little like a pink carpet. Maybe a more transparent design?
This pre-release has chat reporting, therefore it is bad.
You guys should remove Chat Reporting in the next Pre-Release so I have a reason to update my game when 1.19.3 comes out! :D
I love the changes to variants! I hope to see a new update where players can now execute commands without needing capitals! It would make using Minecraft commands much easier

I can't wait for this! Keep up the good work, Mojang!

I've been playing since 2015!

Would be appreciated if the preview functionality could be added back in some form (e.g. how the 1.19.2 "Chat Preview: While Sending" option worked). I understand that sending the full input text while typing has certain privacy/security implications but sending the text when the user actually presses enter would work around it. This would allow servers to still modify chat in a transparent way and for players to acknowledge (and even sign) modified messages and know the server wont be able to change what they said. The way it is implemented now completely removes this trust between the player and the server.

One could say that because the modified marker and the original text will still show when hovered this wont be as big of an issue but I feel like many people will only read the text and already judge what was said without hovering over (potentially every) message to see what was modified. And even if they do, the damage to the reputation of the player might already be done (e.g. a ban by a too hasty mod or just a "friends" group). Re-adding the preview in a toned down way would help there (and the players that don't want the two enter presses for the preview acknowledgement and just want to trust the server could just disable it in the options)
I think that the creative inventory order should be consistently worked on but more than anything comprehensive survey and feedback sought from builders: it's a hard thing to get right

GERMAN :Ich mÃ¶chte das alte kreative Inventar Ich mag das neue nicht

ENGLISH: I want the old creative inventory I don't like the new

About the change for more minor versions:

This might reduce hype for the update and make the update harder to find, or may cause confusion, as calling it 1.19.3 sounds like it would be a tweak to 1.19. New minor versions for new updates should be called 1.xx Release (#). (In this case, 1.20 Release 1.)

Bamboo feedback: the texture seems a little unpolished, in my opinion. The texture is the main part it stands out from, say, birch wood. Camels: should spawn in deserts, savannas, and mesas at a low chance. Should pause randomly near water to gulp down water (maybe for ~30 seconds, should have a cool down of 10 minutes).
give us back the old creative inventory, this one makes me cry

okay here is my feedback, if i dont' mention something it's cause its perfect:

- the bamboo wood type texture looks pretty bland, its outline isnt super defined wich makes it look out off place especially when used on its own, and there is no variation at all in the texture, from what i checked online (and saw irl) stacks of dried bamboo are very diverce in texture (some peaces of bamboo are a bit darker/brownish, some are a bit redish, etc..) but the texture rn is very uniform; am comparing this to tilled deepslate which has suttle but very nice variants in dark-grey colors, having those suttle variants would make the bamboo wood set look much better eather on its own or with other blocks

Edit: after some consideration/analysing of the texture, what makes it awkward to use isnt the lack of outline or variation, instead its the very bright yellow (and its slight green tint) wich is very hard to blend with anything else in the game

- am surprised we didnt have a haybell style block for the bamboo family, i think having a rotational bamboo "log" or "stack" or wathever with a top/bottom texture showing the holes of the cut bamboo (and maybe a green rope holding the stack together like on the raft texture) would look very very nice

- and finally, the leap animation of the camel looks a bit janky, especialy the legs part, i think it needs reworking, or just working in general

and Voila ! that was my feedback, hope it was usefull and maybe even taken into consideration ;)
why can't we find the petrified oak slab in the creative inventory anymore?
I think we should be able to craft torches with bamboo

Made a lengthy comment on the thread but to add one thing:

 

OK I typed out the below without realizing this is an issue with riding mobs. Still think it needs to be fixed. I think if a mob is ridden (camels, llamas, horses), it should be effected by slow falling (I imagine it may be for balance instead of a bug since spider jockeys are unaffected, but I want slow falling camel yeet for funny mountain descents).

Camels with slow falling should still descend slowly. Would be a great niche use for their jumps and could make for fun extreme camel parkour. Its not too OP and can make for a subpar but funny early game elytra (as it requires you start from a high place and is much much slower with less maneuverability while also requiring brewing potions).

The camels rise their neck too much when looking at entities and it's mostly noticeable when they look at the player, probably because the eyes position doesn't line up with the actual head of the camel, we can see that by showing headboxes in game.
I think we should get to dress the camels in fabric like the llamas since we didn't get the Tuff Golems :)

It would be cool if we could make torches with bamboo but they're two blocks tall when placed down and take two bamboo sticks in a workbench to craft. It would be cool aesthetically to have normal ones and soulfire ones, but also if they shone further than normal torches since they're elevated. Maybe only make it possible to place them on the ground as well.

I'm concerned about this next update. It's very underwhelming, even if we've only been shown part of it. While I love these decorative non-full blocks like hanging signs, the devs seem like they're only interested in satisfying intrinsically-motivated players, judging from Minecraft Live.

I like to build, but building is NOT the main reason why me & my friends buy Minecraft. It's the survival mode that we like. We build bases to protect ourselves, we like to adventure & fight mobs to get loot that is useful for survival. Many players are extrinsically motivated, and if mobs like glow squid, goats & frogs only give decor items as rewards, then they won't bother. It's a consistent problem lately, and now sniffer is (yet again) giving only decor items without any survival use. I love these ancient plants, but we NEED to have both aesthetics & function.

Minecraft was dying on 1.12, but it became popular again after 1.13, 1.14, and 1.16, because there's actually more than just building. We have tridents & netherite, which are useful items for survival, and we have more adventure & combat. I want a game, not just a 3D building app. Many Minecraft mods like the Aether, and Minecraft-inspired games like Terraria & Hytale understand this. It's not just aesthetics & gimmicks, it's tangible rewards. Maybe Minecraft isn't for me, but there's no alternatives at the moment. Minecraft on mobile/console lack Java mods, Terraria is unfortunately 2D, and Hytale isn't coming out soon.
There is no Camel and no bundles and no new block is the Screenshot
bro i hate the new inventory with a burning pasion
it would be cool if we could put bundles on camels just like we can put a chest on donkeys!
Very good snapshot, I like the new 1.20 items! And I like the new creative inventory, the old one was a complete mess. But can you please re-add the Petrified oak slab back to the creative inventory?
Make hanging signs display the message on both sides of it and not just one!
Chiseled Bookshelves should have its own UI so you wont have to waste time filling your inventory with the books you put in to find the book you want only to waste more time putting them all back.
I would like that if you want to take the second book from the shelf, then you pointed the mouse at it and right-clicked the mouse and it gave out the second book instead of the sixth

The updated creative inventory is honestly a lot harder to use due to some of the changes, most of the changes are pretty good, such as functional blocks being their own category.

The main issue is the split between building blocks and nature blocks.

It used to be that blocks were categorised by functionality, with solid blocks and non-solid blocks being separate, which made perfect sense, and made it much easier to find what block you're after. Every other category still follows this system, such as crafting materials being their own category.

With the new inventory however, blocks such as planks, carpets, fences, and doors are all put together in a single category, despite these being completely different in terms of functionality.

All this does is make the inventory confusing to navigate, and just makes building more annoying.

 

A much simpler solution would be to instead split the categories between solid blocks, non-solid blocks, and functional blocks, which would make the inventory much more intuitive to use, as all the categories would be consistent that way.

-I'm not hyped on minecraft live and this next update, there's nothing in it that really excites me, but I guess that's the point...? Is it a good idea to do that immediately after all the recent bad stuff like chat report?

-And this tactic doesn't lower player expectations... now online comments are actually coping and hoping that there will be much more to this update. But something tells me this is already 50% of the update, and it's gonna be a small bland update where there's just one more animal and block, without anything really exciting.

-I'm not interested in this update theme of expressing yourself with signs and bookshelves.... I feel like it's useless, especially since I play alone. I want something more like the nether update, where there's more loot, exploration and fights.
i dont really like the new inventory,its quite unorganized and its hard to use. i like the old one more as i already got used to it for years
I had a similar thought but with added Sniffer functionality in finding the seed/spore.

This is a amazing snapshot.The sonic blast warden ranged attack feels perfect in vallina.The small tweaks are very well received by me.But, I think allay regeneration should be slower.I also am not a fan of some of the new advancement names.

The sonic boom certainly gets the job done. Might need to tweak it so it only triggers when the warden is otherwise unable to pathfind to the player - that way if the player decides to disengage and run away, they won't be punished as heavily for it. It definitely serves its intended purpose of messing people up who get too greedy however!

Iâ€™ve never written a comment on this website before because iâ€™m usually really for what changes have been made, but as much as i love the new ranged attack, my only complaint is it does WAY too much damage with no way to avoid it. Personally it should be more of a â€œget down from thereâ€ attack rather than a one hit kill move if you try to escape the Warden. Donâ€™t get me wrong it should absolutely do a lot of damage. but i feel like either minimal to no armor, it should be AT LEAST 2 hits before it kills you. I understand this is one personâ€™s opinion and may get overlooked but I personally feel like itâ€™s a bit unbalanced! :) thank you for your time!
The warden ranged attack animation should look like The souls it has in its "belly cage". It seems at least more fitting for me

This snapshot made the warden more terrifying than it already is. The range attack feels too over powered as you can't run away and get hit like a guardian's lazer beam. It should have a distance dependant damage instead being the same as melee damage. So player at least has a chance against range attack.

Side idea, ik the warden lives in caves and dont have any vegetation, but feels weird when the ravager can break leaves whiles the warden cant
Oh yeah forgot to mention, the death message for warden range attack should be "Player was blasted by Warden"

Personally I feel like the Warden has become a bit *too* hard to avoid at this point, like with the removal of being able to break shriekers while they're shrieking to prevent warden spawns, and its ability to sniff players out, there really is no good way to get away from it, short of having ender pearls or elytra, both of which make noise anyway. I get that you shouldn't be able to kill the warden, at least not easily, but it shouldn't be impossible to avoid either, because then the only option left is to die. The ancient city loot also just isn't really good enough to warrant actually going into one, unless you *really* want Swift Sneak or a Recovery Compass, and a recovery compass probably isn't going to be very useful to someone who is able to avoid dying while getting one. I really liked how the Warden was in the last snapshot, and I think giving it a ranged attack on top of everything else is just overcompensating.

Alright let's do this!

 

Firstly the snapshot is very cool (Like always lol)

I think it's a very smart idea to make sure that the warden can stop players from just towering up.

The damage is okay, maybe half it or just decrease it a little bit, just a tad.

The mangrove changes are great, good to know that Mojang keeps listening to their community!

Especially the mud being now 3 or 4 blocks deep. It's great!

 

I still have a question about a few things (I know I probably won't get an answer but whatever)

- Are fireflies still a thing? Or are they just cut from the update?

- What about the art about the birch forest, just art or is it still coming?

- And the most important one:

Now that the warden has been buffed (wich is a good thing) will the loot change? more unique loot, more uses for echo shards? etc. I know this sounds really greedy and I am sorry for that, but I have heard a lot of players say they probably won't go to an ancient city, because there just isn't enough reason to go there. Maybe give echo shards some extra uses? 

I have already submitted an idea for a new use:

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/5462630687757-The-Echo-Table-Use-for-Echo-Shards-

this is just an idea but I hope there will be more uses for echo shards.

Overall a great snapshot! Mojang listened to their communtiy with the new attack and the mangrove changes! 

Keep going Mojang!

10/10 snapshot

bye

I think the warden's sonic blast should deal more knockback on the x/z axis in order to more effectively counter players that pillar upwards. In this snapshot, the warden typically uses the attack right underneath the player, causing the player to be knockbacked upwards and landing on the same block that they were already on.

I really like the changed to mid generation in the mangrove swamp, I think it would be really neat if the packed mud block spawned in-between stone and mud, or maybe if packed mud replaced stone in these biomes.
I think the warden should not shoot his laser at people behind walls,if so make it impossible to shoot thru two thick walls

Loving these snapshots!

Little suggestion to make the warden more powerful and scary.

Wardens should not repeat the roar animation after it kills its target and immediately starts attacking the next target if multiple targets are heard within distance. The roar animation should only be repeated after the target gets killed, and no other target is immediately detected.

The Sonic Shriek ranged attack should be less powerful than the Warden's melee attack. This shriek attack should also have other side effects, like forcing pointed dripstone stalactites to fall if the attack happens to hit them. I think the Sonic Shriek attack should also create a status effect that temporarly impairs the players ability to hear other sounds, like a high frequency sound that prevents the player from hearing any other noise until the effect wears off.

The ranged attack currently does way too much damage and cannot be dodged (a shield blocks the attack if you're prepared, but just pulling it out when the warden is about to use its ranged attack takes too long). I feel like the damage should be significantly reduced (1/3 its current amount), and there should be some way to get out of the way of the attack if you are far enough away.

The Warden's ranged attack definitely looks very powerful, but I feel like it's missing something. I definitely think said attack should be able to destroy blocks. Under certain circumstances, the ranged attack is very powerful, but it would also be more threatening if the Warden either destroys blocks around them (of course the number of blocks destroyed also would be dependant of the blast resistance of the block). Taking for example, you try to strip-mine to avoid the Warden. Sure, the ranged attack would make quick work out of you, but it would be scarier if the Warden basically opens its path towards you to finish you off with its melee attack. This same case would apply to digging down, pillaring up or trapping the Warden in a block cage.

I like the Warden's ranged attack a lot, but it's still easy to cheese it with ranged weapons. The Warden can't detect you if you build up to a certain height, so I was thinking to let the ranged attack travel up to the height limit and increase the Warden's verticle range of sniffing so it can be harder for players to use ranged weapons on it.

The attack is a bit too powerful right now. The warden's meant to be scary, but being chased loses a lot of intensity if you can't even get close to escaping, because the attack ignores walls, does the same damage as a melee attack, and disables shields.

Decreasing the damage can have a variety of tradeoffs. Here's some ideas:

  • Increase the knockback, so if you're pillaring, it knocks you down.
  • Allow the blast to break (most) blocks, so the warden can reach you and deal the final blow.
  • The damage is greater the closer you are to the warden.
  • Make the bolt move slower but ignore shields.

When I said "Be creative we love to see what you come up with" you really took it to heart. I love the new ranged attack and its definitely a creative solution to the problem and was the sort of thing I had in mind. I'm not sure that it should go threw walls as if you don't have a line of sight with it you cannot easily hurt it which resolves most issues, I like another users idea of "making it impossible to shoot thru thicker walls". Destroyed shriekers sill summoning wardens and increased smell range was a great fix. For shriekers while in creative mod please make crtl+middle button copy the can_summon tag, it would really speed up creative builds using summoning shriekers. good changes to mangroves, still kind of hard to boat threw though.

I have a few problems with the Warden's new shockwave attack. First, I think it uses it too often. It should only use this attack if it can't reach you at all. Players should still be able to run away from the Warden without being one shot by a heatseeking projectile. Second, I think wool should be able to be used to counter the Warden's new shockwave in some way. Either it stops the attack entirely or decreases the damage to some degree. Maybe the shockwave stops after going through a certain number of wool blocks so that it still feels fair and you can get to a safe place.

itâ€™s really good that it HAS a ranged attack to be a better threat, but my worry is that itâ€™s now a worry that iâ€™d be totally unaware of whatâ€™s happening while digging, then suddenly get vaporized. Possibly some way to assure the biomes themselves are spaced well enough so that theyâ€™re a rarity to find and be avoided at the very least.

INCREDIBLE snapshot! Warden finally has anti-cheese, and it's perfect. The sonic boom's high damage is necessary considering how slow the animation is, and how there's many distracting mobs behind walls. Now it feels like an appropriate mini-boss!

It's still possible to cheese the sonic boom with a shield, but that might be okay. I like how it's penetrating & homing (to easily kill bats), but with the shield, players can dodge the attack, and there's plenty of telegraphed warnings before it shoots. If players think shield cheese is too OP, booms can deal partial damage to shielded players.

I think the Warden is perfect now. It's a natural disaster meant to be avoided, but for bored players who want a challenge, they can fight them. Considering how OP the Ancient City loot is, the Warden's difficulty needs to match. I'm really hoping there's more challenging enemies & huge dungeons in the future, as many players prefer the combat/looting/RPG part of the game more so than building. Roguelike dungeon dimensions that resets after clearing, and rare equipment drops with varying stats to trade with, will make Minecraft's combat/looting truly infinite.

Allay regen is great, though outposts need to have higher chance of Allays. Ideally there should still be a way to breed/renew Allays. Players won't take them to caves as a mining partner if Allays are non-renewable; they still die easily to creepers/lava. I'm loving the Mangrove biome changes so far; it's more lively.
allow sugar cane to be panted on mud and not require water next to it.

Mangroves (1/2):

  • Looks great, but still needs more water. There should be large waterways in between denser areas of the mangrove for boat accessibility.
  • Deeper mud is nice, deeper snow should also be added to snowy plains & taiga for the same reason
  • Biome placement needs work, I've seen microbiomes generating in the middle of deserts and oceans. They should generate on the edges of oceans/lakes and go inland from there, connected primarily via water than land.
  • More vegetation would make the place feel more alive, ex: cattails. A new crop like rice would also be cool.
  • Unique flowers, ex: water lily/mud lotus. Should be large, placable near water, 1-3 deep water, and lilypads (duh). They could also emit particles, would be a nice alternative to spore blossoms
  • These biomes are super laggy because of the leaves and vines, it's about time Bedrock's leaf rendering system is brought to Java. Don't want this to become like the Java jungle which players try to avoid because of lag...
  • Add Fallen trees from bedrock too, this is the perfect update to add them. Also add the snowy leaves from bedrock.

So far I love everything in this snapshot, and I hope this will come to Bedrock! Wardens are now scary in a good way, and they can actually kill Withers. I like the new sniff range and how it can shoot while running. There's a lot of creative uses for Wardens now, such as sonic boom turret towers to guard bases. Please don't nerf the Wardens! There's still plenty of ways to deal with Wardens, such as shields, buckets, or simply running away from the deep dark the moment it spawns. Having fearsome mobs you're meant to avoid in the wild is something I've always wanted, it gives a sense of danger to adventures, it's boring if fully-enchanted players can steamroll through everything.

Take inspiration from popular mods and games like Subnautica & Hytale. There's a reason why these are so popular. Bedrock edition is stuck without mods, so I'm hoping that vanilla Minecraft can keep growing!

I'm against Wardens breaking blocks, it's going to ruin worlds. In the future, powerful enemies should ignore blocks instead of destroying them, like this sonic boom attack.

The mangrove changes are for the better; the tall dense trees, the tropical fishes, more mud, moss carpets... now it just needs fireflies and ambient sound effects, and possibly flowering lily pads and fog like in the concept arts. I love tall giant trees, as they make forests look like forests.

The "sneak 100" achievement is essential to teach players that they can sneak through sculk, it should be on Bedrock as well.
Worden breaks glass/blocks with this sonic boom attack.

Mangroves (2/2):

  • It's great that they tropical fish spawn in these biomes. Would be cool if tadpoles also spawn naturally.
  • Idk if it's been removed, but if not, please make the axolotls not hunt tadpoles.
  • If no other plants are added, at least make dripleaf generate in these waters. Would fill out the biome nicely.
  • Frogspawn (frog eggs) should naturally generate in the banks. 
  • Also rename this biome to just "mangroves" to differentiate it better with the old swamps.

Also the sky should turn light grey when entering this biome. Sky color change is something that can be done to all the biomes really, makes them more atmospheric. Biome specific fog would also be amazing. Datapacks such as Terralith already do this really well. 

Old Swamps:

Currently they look so depressing compared to the new mangroves. I think they need a facelift too.

  • The simplest thing to do is just rename them "wetlands", since they tend to have a lot more water
  • Replace the dirt with mud/podzol, and add bushes in between. Also increase the tree density a little
  • Finally add dripleaf, and add fireflies as well

These are fairly simple changes that wouldn't take much effort yet would go a long way to make the old swamps look better.

Mud:

  • Mud should slow players down similar to soul sand. Depth strider would reduce that slowing, like how it works in water.
  • Mud should generate under rivers/riverbanks too, instead of clay and gravel.
  • The witch hut should be made of mud instead of spruce, makes sense

In terms of sound pressure, if the sonic waves erupting from the Warden were reduced enough to just blasting things away with significant damage, the death message for an entity could be: "Entity was jarred by Warden".

However, if this "sonic boom" is enough to instantly kill an entity without any means of protection (which is a brilliant idea mind), shouldn't the death message be: "Entity was irradiated by Warden".
I was playing the new update checking out the new biomes when i realised tht nothing has been done to brich forests yet you said they would be updated in  the stream but they havent been yet why
the chest in the center should have a little more than a gapple
i dont actually think the moss carpets look good with the mangrove maybe they could use mangrove leaf... carpets

I think that echo shards in their current iteration don't make a lot of sense from an overall perspective - it would seem that players who would most appreciate the functionality of the new compass most would be newer players, or at least players who aren't far enough along in their worlds to know exactly where they were when they died. In both of these cases where the compass would be most useful, it would seem to me that the players in need of the compass would either lack the resources to make the compass, or would have so few echo shards that the compass would be seen as too valuable to risk losing (the good old "what if I need it more later" trap that lots of players fall into in games). I like the idea of an item exclusive to the cities, but having a raw material that most benefits players who aren't very far in their worlds located in an area that many would see as a challenge doesn't make a lot of sense to me.

nerf the warden or add a gamerule stoping his spawning as hes a god

and not very fun as you meant to run away or use snowballs but none of them work now
When the Warden does its shockwave attack, it should stand completely still to give players time to run away.

Warden sonic boom:

  • The sonic attack is cool, but if the warden is gonna be this much hard the ancient cities will need more special items to make it worth exploring.
  • Potions that are unobtainable in survival otherwise would be a great option. Ex: A haste X potion, with a duration of say 1-3 mins would be perfect. This will incentivize players to visit multiple cities to stock up on these potions. This is also much more useful than EGAs, which most people only collect as a novelty.
  • The sonic attack needs to be weaker, since it's ranged it should say only be 1/4th as strong as its melee. This way players who tower up won't be insta killed, but still would get knocked down which I think is the point of this attack.
  • Wool should be able to block this attack, similar to how it blocks sculk signals.
  • This attack should do an AoE damage to all the mobs in the direction. However, it should be dodgeable, unlike guardian beams. Since guardians zone in and laser sight the player before sending the blast, but the warden just blasts in the general direction, it makes sense why the sonic boom would be dodgeable.
  • Considering the warden is much harder to avoid now, he should spawn less frequently in the ancient cities. A simple way to do that is to just reset the 3 strikes rule after every warden summon. This way the difficulty of the ancient cities is kept in check, while also giving each warden summon a mythical feel as you encounter this now rare, legendary monster.

Ancient cities:

  • Currently they seem too common (both the biome and cities). I've generated 5 worlds and 3 of them had a city right below spawn, and the other 2 had on within 1500 block radius from spawn. They should be a lot rarer, as rare as mansions.
  • The majority of sculk shriekers should be limited to the ancient cities. The deep dark biome itself should have them less frequently, say one every 200 blocks or so.
  • From my testing, glow lichen doesn't seem to generate in the deep dark. This is concerning, because without them the underground is just impossible to see unless you change the gamma. Hence make glow lichen generate here in the same way it generates everywhere else.
  • The catalyst and shrieker should have a light level of 7, making them easier to spot and avoid.
  • "Deep dark explorer" maps should be found in mansion/outpost chests.
  • Increase the loot in the ice box. Currently they just have some cooked potatoes, doesn't really sell the idea of a food storage. Even bastions have more food and they are a lot smaller.
  • Move the redstone rooms to mansions. Instead maybe go for an evil lab aesthetic, with a bunch of different mobs, trapped in rooms with catalysts. The piston door triggered by eating/walking is nice though. You could also include some sculk related redstone, involving sensors/shriekers. But all the others, i.e. target block, lectern and the various delay circuits seem too basic and don't fit in with the ancient cities' vibe, so they just need to go.
Do you think you could add a non bug related way to avoid the ranged attack, example: a new shield exclusive enchantment.

Where the warden stands right now goes against the very principle on which this game stands.

Forcing the players to deal with a warden in only one singular way, takes away player choice which is the fundamental core of this game. Aside from damaging the very core of your game you have also made this new update blatantly inaccessible to your younger players and your disabled players.

By taking away our power to hide or pillar away to help us cope with our fear and the difficulty of the game, you have made this game blatantly inaccessible to younger children and disabled people with anxiety disorders, trauma disorders, paranoia disorders, schizoaffective disorders, and also directly targets people who have limited mobility and would not be able to effectively run away or hide without these methods. (And this doesn't even begin to get into how much of a nightmare the blindness effect is if you are low vision.)

This is not good game design.

This is not accessible game design. 

You did not design these new features for the warden to improve your game. 

You designed it to target players who had made a choice to make the deep dark more accessible. You've inadvertently designed it to target the disabled.

With this most recent snapshot you have taken what was supposed to be a fun boogeyman and forced a dark souls horror to stand where it had no business to stand. 

This is not okay. Please do not forget about your disabled playerbase in the coming update.

I might be the only one but I don't like the sonic boom particle effect (I'm not a fan of beam-like attacks and attacks you can't avoid, and in this case a beam-like effect doesn't make much sense to be honest). Maybe instead of this attack the warden could release some souls from its chest that move moderately fast and despawn in 5-10 seconds, but are able to pass through walls and do a lot of damage.

This would give the player a chance to flee the attack (by running), while discouraging them from "camping" strategies; after all, the warden being a challenge doesn't mean facing it should be a death sentence (surely it should be hard). Besides, a souls attack makes much more sense.

Nerf the warden as heâ€™s basically a god now with no way to get away from and can insta kill you 

and he does not belong in the game

or add a game rule stoping him spawning
When doing a sonic boom, the warden should damage all the entities in the direction it attack, and the damage could be share between the entities.

I loved this change, and the fact that the Warden does the Sonic boom even when running is great, it really gets you into the immersion and fear.

But I also think that the previous two snapshot changes should be reverted.

The Warden should get back to 5 block melee attack range, because if you lock him in you can easily kill him because the Warden is slow to Sonic boom.

And also the Warden's speed change in water/lava should be reversed because now it's very slow and the current of water/lava pushes it, allowing the player to abuse this and kill the Warden very easily, I'm not saying it's the same faster than before but something intermediate between the speed of before and now that allows it to even pass over currents of water/lava with ease. :)

The blast from the warden does need some work, as it currently just means instant death for the player(in hard)unless you have top level gear, which feels odd given the loot of the city is still more mid level. With the punch, it's actually quite fun with it being so strong, as the player then has to learn how to dodge and trick the warden to survive. The Sonic Blast takes this away, not necessarily because it's powerful, but just because there's nothing for the player to do. There is no way to dodge, no way to block(with the message from devs regarding shields being negated)meaning once it activates, the player basically just has to give up, isn't very enjoyable gameplay.

My solution is using balance: The blast doesn't lock on to players so they could dodge(but will still work for towering)but it turns into an area affect attack, so the player still has a good chance of being hit. But they still have at least a chance, which is currently not the case at least in the cities where there's plenty of places where both the warden and player gets stuck and can't escape

one other idea I had to counter this is an item using the echo shards where they could be used to craft a new item(maybe also using the amethyst shards since they're in the cites to)that absorbs some of the blast when hand held, keeping the player alive(but still taking hurt and knock back)This could also give it a charge, so the player could use a micro version of the blast, but has to take a big risk to get it

I feel like you should make it so that the warden's sonic booms do splash damage, but the killed mobs don't drop any experience and loot. Also, make it be able to walk on lava and/or water like the strider or swim very fast in those to make it more difficult to trap them. Also increase the HP and damage of the warden a bit.
I suggest that fossils should be added in the deep dark because it would make the deep dark biome have more content by itself.

fix the warden so you can get away

and look at this bug https://bugs.mojang.com/browse/MC-250247 

The bug report is important for custom world gen

I like so far how the Warden is evolving but I think the Warden should also be able to change his hitbox to 2 blocks high to enter narrow tunnels, imagine the terror in the player's eyes seeing the Warden desperately running towards you lol.

I also think that the Warden should be able to climb at least 2 blocks high, this would allow him to reach the player more easily without being too OP, since in the new ancient cities there are many structures that are 2 blocks high from the ground and the Warden just stands there looking at the player without doing anything other than the Sonic boom, allowing the player to make consecutive attacks without taking any damage. Additionally, this new ability would also allow the Warden to better traverse the new caves in Caves & Cliffs Update Part II.

I like the changes they are making to the Allay but I think they should change a couple of aspects.

The Allay should go through any type of block taking no damage (except for the Bedrock), this will allow you to pick up and throw items much faster without the need to make complex changes to the pathfinding of the Allays. Obviously this would make the Allays escape from their cells in mansions or pillager outposts but since they only spawn in structures I think it would be possible to alter their AI so that in these places are unable to move.

Also the player should be able to assign the Allay a notes block with a single left click, because the current fix only causes more lag and confusion for the players. :)

This new warden is perfect for hard difficulty players, players like me who choose hard/hardcore mode actually desire a challenge. But for "kids and disabled people" as the above comment says, they can choose easy or peaceful mode. Wardens greatly improved the game, and many players enjoyed it. The massive amounts of youtube reaction vids will promote minecraft further. Please don't take the fun away from many players.

I'm against nerfing wardens, at least on hard/normal mode. Easy mode can have the nerfs, as players who choose easy mode prefer a more casual game.

The warden should walk a bit faster on water. It gets stuck too often on liquid. The vertical melee reach should be extended a bit, like in the previous snapshots.

I prefer ancient cities to be more common. It should NOT be as rare as woodland mansions, they are a pain to find and exploring takes up too much disk space.
